content: to form neck and are 8 stitches wide secure yarn and knot securely do not cut ends as you pull through body to hide ends repeat will use these to define arms as noted on opposite side for second arm below stuff body embroider bangs sew a running stitch of matching yarn using a strand of yarn that matches your across cast-on edge then stuff the hair colour make several long stitches body loosely draw up to close bottom refer to the photos for placement of doll and knot securely do not cut ends as you will use this to define the embroider eyes legs embroider eyes in black pull a strand of define legs black yarn under both legs of a stitch begin at the back middle seam and knit 3 horizontal stitches in the same pull yarn through to the front middle stitch then pull the needle through the using the chart as a guide count 16 doll and bring up at the opposite side stitches from the back middle seam to for the second eye make 3 horizontal the front keeping the first few stitches stitches then pull the needle through loose can also help guide a straight the doll and bring up beside original seam pull snuggly to create leg yarn tail tie a knot to fasten yarn definition as you continue to a few row securely then pull through body of doll below the sweater fasten yarn to hide ends securely cheeks referring to photo for placement add small circles of powdered blush using a cotton swab 4 follow me on instagram @estherjoyknits for more tips tutorials and project ideas cozy izzy dolls a knitting pattern by esther braithwaite designs *note chart reflects stitch count 32 stitches for circular knitting only * when knitting the pattern on straight needles you must add 1 stitch to either side of the pattern for seaming 34 stitches required * 5 follow me on instagram @estherjoyknits for more tips tutorials and project ideas
